item.title: 中国收紧电动汽车出口规定，2026 年起必须获得许可
item.description: 从明年起，中国的汽车制造商出口电动汽车将需要许可证，这进一步表明中国政府正在加强对全球最大汽车市场的管理。【原文：China’s automakers will need permits to export electric vehicles from next year, adding to signs officials are tightening their management of the world’s biggest car market.】

item.title: Meta 将在英国推出付费版 Facebook 和 Instagram
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. 不久将在英国提供付费版 Facebook 和 Instagram，这两个平台将取消广告。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. will soon offer paid versions of Facebook and Instagram in the UK that will remove advertising from both platforms.】

item.title: 经济学家下调美国到 2026 年的就业增长，助推降息
item.description: 经济学家们下调了对明年年底前美国就业增长的预测，这有助于解释为什么美联储预计将继续降低利率。【原文：Economists downgraded their projections for US job growth through the end of next year, helping explain why the Federal Reserve is expected continue to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 法国农民用拖拉机抗议欧盟与南方共同市场的贸易协定
item.description: 农民们在法国各地举行抗议活动，敦促政府阻止欧盟与南美国家的自由贸易协定，保护他们免受他们所说的不公平竞争。【原文：Farmers staged protests across France, urging the government to block a European Union free-trade deal with South American nations and protect them from what they say will be unfair competition.】

item.title: 游说团体称，新规实施后全球银行可能在欧盟增加 1000 个工作岗位
item.description: 由于新规定将于 2027 年生效，预计全球银行将为其在欧盟的业务增加或转移多达 1000 名员工。【原文：Global banks are expected to add or move as many as 1,000 employees to their operations in the European Union because of new rules that will take effect in 2027.】

item.title: 美国承诺向莫桑比克提供 1.6 亿美元的艾滋病和结核病援助
item.description: 美国承诺为莫桑比克提供 1.6 亿美元的临时援助，用于艾滋病毒和结核病的检测和治疗，而此前数月的不确定性是由于 1 月份的外援审查导致美国国际开发署关闭而引发的。【原文：The US pledged $160 million in interim assistance for HIV and tuberculosis testing and treatment in Mozambique, after months of uncertainty triggered by a foreign aid review in January that led to the closure of the US Agency for International Development.】

item.title: 特朗普医药关税计划看似许多制药商的缓兵之计
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对进口品牌药和专利药征收 100%的关税，许多投资者对这一计划无动于衷。【原文：President Donald Trump’s plan to impose a 100% tariff on branded and patented drug imports was greeted with a shrug by many investors, who are betting his exemptions for companies with US manufacturing will soften any blow.】

item.title: 尽管有贸易战，外国人购买美股的速度仍创纪录
item.description: 去年春天，唐纳德-特朗普发动了贸易战，妄想吞并加拿大，并普遍扰乱了全球对美国的情绪，外国买家抵制美国金融产品的担忧日益加剧。【原文：As Donald Trump unleashed his trade war, mused about annexing Canada and generally roiled global sentiment toward the US last spring, worries mounted that foreign buyers would boycott American financial products.】

item.title: 印度最大的植物油买家认为更便宜的豆油推动了棕榈油的转移
item.description: 印度是世界上最大的植物油买家，据一位顶级进口商称，明年印度将增加豆油的采购量，因为全球大豆作物的丰收使得豆油的价格比竞争对手棕榈油便宜。【原文：India, the world’s biggest vegetable oil buyer, is poised to boost soybean oil purchases next year as bumper global crops have made the commodity cheaper than rival palm, according to a top importer.】

item.title: 中国人工智能电路制造商摩尔芯线上海上市获绿灯
item.description: 摩尔线程技术有限公司（Moore Threads Technology Co.【原文：Moore Threads Technology Co., which makes equipment used in areas like artificial intelligence and machine learning, received approval from the Shanghai Stock Exchange for its initial public offering on the Star Market.】

item.title: 任天堂任命二十年资深人士掌管美国业务
item.description: 任天堂公司（Nintendo Co., Ltd.）任命了一位新的领导人，从明年起负责美国业务，提升了一位在业界工作了 19 年的资深人士，以监督 Switch 2 在其最大市场的进展情况。【原文：Nintendo Co. has appointed a new leader for its US operations starting next year, elevating a 19-year industry veteran to oversee the Switch 2’s progress in its largest market.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克在《宪法》中对两性做出定义，人权问题备受关注
item.description: 斯洛伐克修订了宪法，只承认男女两性，并将国家主权（尤其是在文化和伦理问题上）置于国际人权条约之上。【原文：Slovakia amended its constitution to recognize only two sexes and prioritize national sovereignty, particularly in cultural and ethical matters, over international human rights treaties.】

item.title: 国际文传电讯社报道：俄罗斯计划继续加大国防开支
item.description: 俄罗斯打算在未来三年内将军费开支维持在较高水平，这削弱了克里姆林宫准备尽快结束乌克兰战争的想法。【原文：Russia intends to keep military expenditures at a high level over the next three years, undermining notions the Kremlin is preparing to end its war on Ukraine any time soon.】

item.title: 瑞士人称瑞银应在 7 年内逐步实施资本规则
item.description: 瑞士政府正式建议给予瑞银集团七年时间来完全满足更高的资本要求，这也确认了之前的指导意见。【原文：Switzerland’s government formally proposed giving UBS Group AG seven years to fully comply with higher capital requirements, confirming previous guidance.】

item.title: 前飓风加布里埃尔袭击亚速尔群岛并在前往欧洲的途中减弱
item.description: 飓风 "加布里埃尔 "的残余正以强风、汹涌的海浪和暴雨袭击亚速尔群岛，但在本周末接近欧洲大陆时，风暴将减弱。【原文：The remnants of Hurricane Gabrielle are hitting the Azores with strong winds, rough seas and heavy rain, but the storm will weaken as it approaches the European mainland this weekend.】

item.title: 日本电产发现更多可能存在不当会计的案例
item.description: 汽车制造商日本电产株式会社在一份延迟发布的年度证券报告中表示，该公司正要求第三方小组调查更多涉嫌不当会计的事件，这使日本科技冠军之一的日本电产又增添了一桩丑闻。【原文：Motor-maker Nidec Corp. said in a delayed annual securities report it was asking a third-party panel to look into additional suspected instances of improper accounting, adding to a scandal weighing on one of Japan’s tech champions.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织资深人士承诺恢复对毛里求斯中央银行的信任
item.description: 在经历了数月的内部争论之后，毛里求斯首位女性央行行长发誓要重建人们对该机构的信心，并采取 "数据驱动 "的货币政策。【原文：Mauritius’s first female central bank governor vowed to rebuild confidence in the institution after it endured months of internal wrangling, and take a “data-driven” approach to monetary policy.】

item.title: 杰克-莫里斯：寻找下一个人工智能重大突破

item.title: 奇数：寻找下一个人工智能大突破（播客）

item.title: 欧洲央行称 8 月消费者通胀预期上升
item.description: 欧洲中央银行表示，8月份欧元区消费者的通胀预期有所上升，支持了不再进一步降息的呼吁。【原文：Inflation expectations among euro-zone consumers increased in August, the European Central Bank said, backing calls to not lower interest rates further.】

item.title: 美联储鸽派押注解除，美元将迎来两个月来最佳一周
item.description: 美元将迎来 8 月初以来最强劲的一周，因为富有弹性的美国数据迫使交易商重新评估美联储的降息空间，并将注意力转向周五的通胀报告。【原文：The dollar is set for its strongest week since early August as resilient US data forced traders to reassess the Federal Reserve’s scope for interest-rate cuts, with attention turning to Friday’s inflation report.】

item.title: 一旦库尔德输油管道出口重启，维托尔公司将洽谈伊拉克石油销售事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，伊拉克正在与维多集团（Vitol Group）谈判，一旦该国库尔德地区的原油出口在停止两年后恢复，维多集团将负责原油销售。【原文：Iraq is in talks with Vitol Group to handle crude sales once exports resume from the country’s Kurdish region after a two-year halt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 俄罗斯阿菲普斯基炼油厂在乌克兰无人机袭击后起火
item.description: 由于乌克兰继续打击敌人的能源基础设施，加剧了燃料短缺，俄罗斯南部的阿菲普斯基炼油厂一夜之间起火。【原文：The Afipsky refinery in southern Russia caught fire overnight as Ukraine continues to strike its enemy’s energy infrastructure, exacerbating fuel shortages.】

item.title: 据说 Blackstone 对跨马尔代夫航空公司的竞购已告吹
item.description: 熟悉此事的人士称，Blackstone Inc. 回购水上飞机运营商 Trans Maldivian Airways Pvt.【原文：A bid by Blackstone Inc. to repurchase seaplane operator Trans Maldivian Airways Pvt. has fallen through, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 埃克森公司大幅招聘，将伦敦能源交易业务增加一倍
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司在过去两年中将在英国工作的交易员人数增加了一倍，因为该公司正在推进从其庞大的全球能源基础设施中赚取更多利润的计划。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. has doubled the number of traders working in the UK over the past two years, as the major presses ahead with plans to make more money from its vast worldwide energy infrastructure.】

item.title: 美国石油流向亚洲面临油轮费昂贵的压力
item.description: 对亚洲买家来说，来自美国的原油可能会变得过于昂贵，原因是油轮运价上涨，而中国购买量的增加和贸易商对欧佩克+供应增加的定位又抬高了油轮运价。【原文：Crude from the US could become too expensive for Asian buyers due to higher tankers rates, which have been inflated by an increase in Chinese purchases and traders positioning for more OPEC+ supply.】

item.title: 欧洲股市上涨，投资者对特朗普的关税计划避而不谈
item.description: 由于投资者对唐纳德-特朗普总统威胁对专利药品征收关税不为所动，欧洲股市上涨。【原文：European stocks gained as investors were unmoved by President Donald Trump’s threats to slap tariffs on patented drugs.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税威胁凸显制药商在美国工厂的进步
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对品牌药和专利药征收100%的关税，这可能会大幅提高没有美国制造能力的制药公司的成本，给尚未破土动工的公司带来更大压力。【原文：President Donald Trump’s plan to impose a 100% tariff on branded and patented drugs could sharply raise costs for pharmaceutical companies without US manufacturing capacity, raising pressure on firms that have yet to break ground.】

item.title: 诺巴银行首次亮相股价大涨，为斯德哥尔摩赢得最新胜利
item.description: 金融服务公司诺巴银行集团（Noba Bank Group AB）的股票在斯德哥尔摩首次公开发行时大涨，标志着在 Verisure Plc 公司大举上市之前，欧洲今年首次公开发行股票的最主要地点受到了推动。【原文：Shares of financial services firm Noba Bank Group AB surged in their Stockholm debut, marking a boost for Europe’s top venue for initial public offerings this year ahead of a blockbuster listing by Verisure Plc.】

item.title: 西班牙第二季度经济增长超预期
item.description: 西班牙经济在第二季度的增长超过了最初的报告，巩固了其在该地区的突出表现。【原文：The Spanish economy expanded more than initially reported in the second quarter, cementing its standout performance in the region.】
